domains.name: Time on Task
domains.description: Captures the extent to which the teacher provides a learning activity (Behavior 0.1) and students remain on task (Behavior 0.2) across three rapid snapshots (1–10 second scans at minutes 4–5, 9–10, and 14–15).

components.name: Teacher provides learning activity - 1st Snapshot
components.description: Teacher provides a learning activity to most students during the first snapshot (between 4:00–5:00 of the segment).
components.rubric: Y: At 4:00–5:00, teacher engages ≥80% of students in a content-related activity—examples include lecturing, small-group/team work, independent worksheet completion, or reading (learning activity). N: At that time, teacher is performing nonlearning tasks—examples include taking attendance, disciplining students, writing silently on board without engaging students—or <80% of students are engaged. If Y=No, Behavior 0.2 is automatically scored as the lowest option. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"Y": 0.90, "N": 0.10}

components.name: Students are on task - 1st Snapshot
components.description: Students' on-task behavior during the first snapshot (4:00–5:00 of the segment).
components.rubric: L: ≥6 students off-task (e.g., staring out window, whispering, passing notes, looking at observer) in scan. M: 2–5 off-task. H: 0–1 off-task. If Behavior 0.1=No, this component is automatically scored as L. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"H": 0.55, "M": 0.36, "L": 0.09}

components.name: Teacher provides learning activity - 2nd Snapshot
components.description: Teacher provides a learning activity to most students during the second snapshot (between 9:00–10:00 of the segment).
components.rubric: Y: At 9:00–10:00, teacher engages ≥80% of students in content-related activities (e.g., lecturing, group work, independent practice). N: At that time, teacher engages in nonlearning tasks or <80% of students are engaged. If Y=No, Behavior 0.2 is automatically scored as the lowest option. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"Y": 0.86, "N": 0.14}

components.name: Students are on task - 2nd Snapshot
components.description: Students' on-task behavior during the second snapshot (9:00–10:00 of the segment).
components.rubric: L: ≥6 students off-task in scan. M: 2–5 off-task. H: 0–1 off-task. If Behavior 0.1=No, this component is automatically scored as L. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"H": 0.49, "M": 0.41, "L": 0.10}

components.name: Teacher provides learning activity - 3rd Snapshot
components.description: Teacher provides a learning activity to most students during the third snapshot (between 14:00–15:00 of the segment).
components.rubric: Y: At 14:00–15:00, teacher engages ≥80% of students in content-related activities (e.g., lecturing, collaborative tasks, independent work). N: At that time, teacher performs noninstructional tasks or <80% engaged. If Y=No, Behavior 0.2 is automatically scored as the lowest option. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"Y": 0.92, "N": 0.08}

components.name: Students are on task - 3rd Snapshot
components.description: Students' on-task behavior during the third snapshot (14:00–15:00 of the segment).
components.rubric: L: ≥6 students off-task in the scan. M: 2–5 off-task. H: 0–1 off-task. If Behavior 0.1=No, this component is automatically scored as L. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"H": 0.56, "M": 0.34, "L": 0.10}

domains.name: Classroom Culture
domains.description: Captures the teacher's creation of an emotionally supportive environment and the management of student behavior through two elements: Supportive Learning Environment and Positive Behavioral Expectations.

components.name: Supportive Learning Environment
components.description: Overall rating of the supportive learning environment (Element 1).
components.rubric: 1: Teacher shames, punishes, or humiliates students (e.g., yells, scolds, ridicules, physical punishment). 3: Teacher neither explicitly respects nor disrespects (neutral tone, no use of names, no positive cues). 5: Teacher consistently uses respectful language and nonverbal cues—calls students by name, says "please"/"thank you", uses culturally relevant gestures. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"4": 0.79, "3": 0.14, "2": 0.04, "5": 0.03}

components.id: The teacher treats all students respectfully
components.name: The teacher treats all students respectfully
components.description: Behavior 1.1 under SLE: Teacher's respectful tone and interactions.
components.rubric: L: Teacher exhibits disrespect (yells, scolds, humiliates, ridicules, physical punishment). M: Teacher refrains from disrespect but shows no explicit respect (neutral tone, no names, no culturally relevant greetings). H: Teacher uses students' names, says "please"/"thank you", or shows other culturally appropriate signs of respect. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"H": 0.84, "M": 0.13, "L": 0.03}

components.name: The teacher uses positive language
components.description: Behavior 1.2 under SLE: Frequency and quality of positive feedback.
components.rubric: L: 0 instances of teacher positive language. M: 1–4 generic praises (e.g., "good job", "well done"). H: ≥5 specific, encouraging statements (e.g., "I like how you solved that problem", "Great work explaining your reasoning"). The historical score proportions for this component are: {"H": 0.69, "M": 0.24, "L": 0.07}

components.id: The teacher responds to students needs
components.name: The teacher responds to students needs
components.description: Behavior 1.3 under SLE: Responsiveness to material or emotional needs.
components.rubric: L: Teacher ignores or dismisses student needs (e.g., does not address missing materials or requests). M: Teacher acknowledges need but does not resolve. H: Teacher promptly and fully addresses needs (e.g., provides a pencil, rearranges partners for a student without one, grants bathroom break). The historical score proportions for this component are: {"H": 0.74, "M": 0.17, "L": 0.09}

components.id: The teacher does not exhibit gender bias
components.name: The teacher does not exhibit gender bias
components.description: Behavior 1.4 under SLE: Equitable treatment and challenge of stereotypes.
components.rubric: L: Teacher shows bias—unequal opportunities, stereotypes, or explicit biased language. M: Teacher provides equal opportunities but does not challenge stereotypes. H: Teacher actively counters stereotypes and models equity (e.g., uses nontraditional role examples, alternates calling on boys and girls equally). The historical score proportions for this component are: {"M": 0.97, "L": 0.02, "H": 0.01}

components.name: Positive Behavioral Expectations
components.description: Overall rating of the teacher's setting and reinforcement of behavior norms (Element 2).
components.rubric: 1: Teacher does not set or reinforce any behavioral expectations. 3: Teacher sets general or superficial expectations (e.g., "Be quiet"). 5: Teacher co-creates clear, specific norms aligned to activities and reinforces them proactively (e.g., "Raise your hand before speaking," "Work silently in pairs"). The historical score proportions for this component are: {"3": 0.45, "4": 0.28, "2": 0.19, "5": 0.07, "1": 0.01}

components.id: The teacher sets clear behavioral expectations
components.name: The teacher sets clear behavioral expectations
components.description: Behavior 2.1 under PBE: Clarity and specificity of expectations.
components.rubric: L: No explicit expectations stated. M: Broad or superficial expectations (e.g., "Be good"). H: Clear, specific expectations tied to each activity (e.g., "Work quietly until I say stop," "Share your ideas one at a time"). The historical score proportions for this component are: {"H": 0.71, "M": 0.23, "L": 0.06}

components.id: The teacher acknowledges positive student behavior
components.name: The teacher acknowledges positive student behavior
components.description: Behavior 2.2 under PBE: Recognition of students meeting or exceeding expectations.
components.rubric: L: No acknowledgement when students meet expectations. M: General praise (e.g., "Good job"). H: Specific, timely acknowledgement referencing behavior and expectations (e.g., "I appreciate how Maria waited her turn before speaking"). The historical score proportions for this component are: {"L": 0.90, "H": 0.07, "M": 0.03}

components.name: The teacher redirects misbehavior
components.description: Behavior 2.3 under PBE: Prompt, clear redirection and reinforcement of norms.
components.rubric: L: Teacher focuses on misbehavior without guidance (e.g., "Stop that!"). M: Redirects but without linking to expectations (e.g., "Quiet down" alone). H: Redirects by reinforcing expected behavior with explanation (e.g., "Please remember we raise hands; thanks for waiting until called upon"). The historical score proportions for this component are: {"H": 0.70, "M": 0.24, "L": 0.06}

domains.name: Instruction
domains.description: Assesses facilitation of lesson objectives, checks for understanding, feedback, and promotion of critical thinking.

components.name: Lesson Facilitation
components.description: Overall rating of lesson facilitation (Element 3).
components.rubric: 1: No clear objectives, explanations, or connections. 3: Some elements present but incomplete or superficial. 5: Teacher seamlessly articulates objectives, provides clear explanations, meaningful connections, and models tasks fully. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"3": 0.55, "4": 0.23, "2": 0.17, "5": 0.03, "1": 0.02}

components.id: The teacher explicitly articulates learning objectives
components.name: The teacher explicitly articulates learning objectives
components.description: Behavior 3.1 under Lesson Facilitation: Stating and referencing objectives.
components.rubric: L: No objectives stated or inferable. M: Broad or inferable objectives only (e.g., "Today we will read a story"). H: Specific objectives stated and referenced (e.g., "Today you will learn to identify action verbs by circling them in sentences"). The historical score proportions for this component are: {"M": 0.47, "H": 0.39, "L": 0.14}

components.id: The teacher's explanation of content is clear
components.name: The teacher's explanation of content is clear
components.description: Behavior 3.2 under Lesson Facilitation: Clarity and comprehensiveness of explanations.
components.rubric: L: Explanations are confusing, jargon-heavy, or absent. M: Partially clear but incomplete or missing definitions. H: Consistently clear, logical explanations—defines terms, uses concrete examples. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"H": 0.77, "M": 0.17, "L": 0.06}

components.id: The teacher makes connections in the lesson
components.name: The teacher makes connections in the lesson
components.description: Behavior 3.3 under Lesson Facilitation: Linking to prior knowledge and experiences.
components.rubric: L: No connections made to prior knowledge or daily life. M: Superficial or unclear connections (e.g., mentions real-world objects without linking to objective). H: Explicit, meaningful connections contextualized to students' experiences (e.g., links multiplication to buying fruits at market). The historical score proportions for this component are: {"L": 0.56, "H": 0.24, "M": 0.20}

components.id: The teacher models by enacting or thinking aloud
components.name: The teacher models by enacting or thinking aloud
components.description: Behavior 3.4 under Lesson Facilitation: Enacting steps with think-aloud.
components.rubric: L: No modeling or think-aloud. M: Partial modeling or partial think-aloud (e.g., shows one step without explaining), or insufficient practice opportunity. H: Full modeling with simultaneous think-aloud—demonstrates entire process and narrates reasoning, with clear student practice follow-up. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"L": 0.65, "M": 0.19, "H": 0.16}

components.name: Checks for understanding
components.description: Overall rating of checks for understanding (Element 4).
components.rubric: 1: No checks or only unverified whole-class prompts. 3: Some checks (e.g., calls on volunteers) without broad monitoring or follow-up. 5: Regular, systematic checks—open-ended questions, monitoring ≥75% of students, adjusts instruction based on evidence. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"3": 0.38, "2": 0.33, "4": 0.18, "5": 0.08, "1": 0.03}

components.name: The teacher uses questions
components.description: Behavior 4.1 under Checks for Understanding: Effective questioning strategies.
components.rubric: L: Only closed questions, no follow-up. M: Some open questions (≥2) but limited probing. H: Regular open-ended questions with follow-up and building on student responses. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"M": 0.58, "H": 0.31, "L": 0.11}

components.name: The teacher uses prompts
components.description: Behavior 4.2 under Checks for Understanding: Prompts guiding thinking.
components.rubric: L: Only factual prompts. M: Some elaboration prompts but limited. H: Regular prompts for justification, evidence, and deeper reasoning (e.g., "Can you explain why?"). The historical score proportions for this component are: {"H": 0.61, "M": 0.32, "L": 0.07}

components.name: The teacher monitors most students
components.description: Behavior 4.3 under Checks for Understanding: Circulation and probing during activities.
components.rubric: L: Teacher remains stationary or scans <50% of students. M: Circulates but monitors 50–75%. H: Systematically supports >75% of students during independent/group work. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"L": 0.71, "M": 0.15, "H": 0.14}

components.name: Feedback
components.description: Overall rating of feedback (Element 5).
components.rubric: L: Evaluative only ('yes/no') without substance. M: Occasional or generic feedback. H: Frequent, specific, actionable feedback guiding correction and reflection. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"M": 0.37, "L": 0.35, "H": 0.28}

components.id: The teacher provides specific comments for misunderstandings
components.name: The teacher provides specific comments for misunderstandings
components.description: Behavior 5.1 under Feedback: Targeted feedback to clarify errors.
components.rubric: L: No or generic feedback on errors. M: Identifies misunderstanding but no scaffolding (e.g., "That's wrong"). H: Detailed prompts guiding correction (e.g., "You swapped numerator and denominator—try reversing them"). The historical score proportions for this component are: {"L": 0.83, "M": 0.10, "H": 0.07}

components.id: The teacher provides specific comments for successes
components.name: The teacher provides specific comments for successes
components.description: Behavior 5.2 under Feedback: Reinforcement of successes.
components.rubric: 1: No recognition or generic praise. 3: Specific but infrequent acknowledgment. 5: Consistent strategic use of exemplars and reflective discussion (e.g., "I like how you used evidence from the text to support your answer"). The historical score proportions for this component are: {"2": 0.41, "3": 0.23, "1": 0.16, "4": 0.12, "5": 0.08}

components.name: Critical Thinking
components.description: Overall rating of critical thinking promotion (Element 6).
components.rubric: L: No higher-order prompts or tasks. M: Occasional open-ended questions without follow-up or superficial tasks. H: Regular open-ended questioning, challenging tasks, and follow-up. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"L": 0.57, "M": 0.21, "H": 0.22}

components.name: The teacher asks open-ended questions
components.description: Behavior 6.1 under Critical Thinking: Teacher questioning to extend reasoning.
components.rubric: L: ≤1 open-ended question, no follow-up. M: 2 open-ended questions, limited probing. H: ≥3 open-ended questions with deep follow-up building on student responses. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"M": 0.60, "L": 0.26, "H": 0.14}

components.name: The teacher provides thinking tasks
components.description: Behavior 6.2 under Critical Thinking: Assignments requiring analysis or interpretation.
components.rubric: L: Rote tasks only (e.g., copying facts). M: Some analytical tasks but limited depth (e.g., compare two examples). H: Complex, novel problem-solving or interpretation tasks requiring higher-order thinking. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"M": 0.56, "L": 0.27, "H": 0.17}

components.id: Students ask open-ended questions or perform thinking tasks
components.name: Students ask open-ended questions or perform thinking tasks
components.description: Behavior 6.3 under Critical Thinking: Student engagement in higher-order thinking.
components.rubric: 1: No student open questions or analytical tasks. 3: Some students perform limited thinking tasks or ask questions. 5: Class collectively leads deep critical thinking—students generate questions and engage in analysis. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"2": 0.41, "3": 0.35, "1": 0.13, "4": 0.10, "5": 0.01}

domains.name: Socioemotional Skills
domains.description: Teaching practices that develop student autonomy, perseverance, and social–collaborative skills.

components.name: Autonomy
components.description: Overall rating of autonomy promotion (Element 7).
components.rubric: L: No meaningful student choices or roles provided. M: Superficial choices (e.g., choose seat) or administrative roles. H: Substantive academic choices and roles central to learning (e.g., select topics, lead discussions). The historical score proportions for this component are: {"L": 0.84, "M": 0.12, "H": 0.04}

components.id: The teacher provides students with choices
components.name: The teacher provides students with choices
components.description: Behavior 7.1 under Autonomy: Meaningful choices tied to objectives.
components.rubric: L: No choices offered. M: Superficial choices unrelated to academic goals (e.g., pick group partner). H: Substantive choices linked to objectives (e.g., choose problem-solving method, select project topic). The historical score proportions for this component are: {"M": 0.48, "L": 0.33, "H": 0.19}

components.id: The teacher provides students with opportunities to take meaningful roles
components.name: The teacher provides students with opportunities to take meaningful roles
components.description: Behavior 7.2 under Autonomy: Assigning central academic roles.
components.rubric: L: No roles assigned. M: Administrative roles only (e.g., line leader). H: Roles central to learning (e.g., peer tutor, group facilitator). The historical score proportions for this component are: {"M": 0.49, "H": 0.32, "L": 0.19}

components.id: Students volunteer to participate in the classroom
components.name: Students volunteer to participate in the classroom
components.description: Behavior 7.3 under Autonomy: Student initiative in participation.
components.rubric: 1: No volunteers. 3: Some volunteers but limited. 5: Virtually all students self-initiate participation without prompting. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"2": 0.85, "3": 0.09, "4": 0.03, "1": 0.03}

components.name: Perseverance
components.description: Overall rating of perseverance promotion (Element 8).
components.rubric: L: Focus on innate ability; negative framing of failure. M: Neutral messages about effort. H: Consistent growth-mindset language and goal-setting encouragement. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"L": 0.88, "M": 0.06, "H": 0.06}

components.name: The teacher acknowledges students' efforts
components.description: Behavior 8.1 under Perseverance: Specific praise of effort.
components.rubric: L: No effort acknowledgement. M: General comments (e.g., "Good work"). H: Specific, process-focused acknowledgments (e.g., "I notice how carefully you checked each step"). The historical score proportions for this component are: {"M": 0.91, "H": 0.06, "L": 0.03}

components.id: The teacher has a positive attitude towards students' challenges
components.name: The teacher has a positive attitude towards students' challenges
components.description: Behavior 8.2 under Perseverance: Framing failure as learning and offering support.
components.rubric: L: Negative or impatient responses to struggle. M: Neutral responses without encouragement. H: Encouraging tone and coping strategies (e.g., "Mistakes help us learn—let's try again"). The historical score proportions for this component are: {"L": 0.96, "H": 0.02, "M": 0.02}

components.name: The teacher encourages goal-setting
components.description: Behavior 8.3 under Perseverance: Promotion of short- and long-term goals.
components.rubric: 1: No goal-setting. 3: Encourages either short- or long-term goals generally. 5: Co-creates measurable short- and long-term growth plans with students regularly. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"1": 0.39, "2": 0.26, "3": 0.20, "4": 0.12, "5": 0.03}

components.name: Social & Collaborative Skills
components.description: Overall rating of social and collaborative skills promotion (Element 9).
components.rubric: L: No structured peer interaction. M: Superficial pair/group work (e.g., share materials). H: Rich interdependent collaboration with explicit social–emotional scaffolds and facilitation. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"L": 0.58, "H": 0.29, "M": 0.13}

components.name: The teacher promotes students' collaboration
components.description: Behavior 9.1 under Social & Collaborative Skills: Designing interdependent group tasks.
components.rubric: L: No collaborative tasks. M: Superficial pair/group work without interdependence. H: Well-structured interdependent collaboration—students rely on each other to complete tasks. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"L": 0.71, "M": 0.21, "H": 0.08}

components.id: The teacher promotes students' interpersonal skills
components.name: The teacher promotes students' interpersonal skills
components.description: Behavior 9.2 under Social & Collaborative Skills: Teaching empathy, perspective-taking, and emotion regulation.
components.rubric: L: Ignores social skills development. M: Basic polite prompts (e.g., "Use your manners"). H: Explicit teaching of empathy, perspective-taking, and conflict resolution strategies. The historical score proportions for this component are: {"L": 0.58, "H": 0.25, "M": 0.17}

name: TEACH 1.0 Classroom Observation Framework
description: Based on the World Bank's TEACH tool, this framework evaluates both the time students spend engaged in learning and the quality of teaching practices across culture, instruction, and socioemotional development. It includes low-inference snapshots and high-inference rubrics with specific evidence examples drawn from the TEACH manual for reliable, evidence-based scoring.
